speaker: Junior Dev
text: Hey! I’ve just pushed the refactored module. I tried to keep the functions small and clear, like you suggested.
ipa: heɪ | aɪv dʒəst pʊʃt ðə riˈfæk.tɚd ˈmɑː.dʒuːl | aɪ traɪd tə kip ðə ˈfʌŋk.ʃənz smɔl ənd klɪr | laɪk ju səɡˈdʒɛs.tɪd
stress: HEY | I’VE JUST PUSHED the REFACTORED MODULE | TRIED to KEEP the FUNCTIONS SMALL and CLEAR | LIKE you SUGGESTED
linking:
"I’ve just" → /aɪv dʒəst/ (smooth connection)
"tried to" → /traɪd tə/ (to reduced)
"like you" → /laɪk ju/ (link k + you)

speaker: You
text: Nice job! I’ve taken a quick look — it’s definitely cleaner. You’ve improved a lot since your first pull request.
ipa: naɪs dʒɑːb | aɪv ˈteɪ.kən ə kwɪk lʊk | ɪts ˈdɛ.fə.nɪt.li ˈkliː.nɚ | juv ɪmˈpruːvd ə lɑt sɪns jɚ fɜrst pʊl rɪˈkwɛst
stress: NICE JOB | I’VE TAKEN a QUICK LOOK | DEFINITELY CLEANER | YOU’VE IMPROVED a LOT SINCE your FIRST PULL REQUEST
linking:
"taken a" → /ˈteɪ.kən ə/ (a reduced to schwa)
"since your" → /sɪns jɚ/ (smooth connection)

speaker: Junior Dev
text: Thanks! I’ve been practicing every day. Honestly, I didn’t even know what “clean code” meant when I joined.
ipa: θæŋks | aɪv bɪn ˈpræk.tɪ.sɪŋ ˈɛv.ri deɪ | ˈɑː.nɪst.li | aɪ ˈdɪd.ənt ˈiː.vən noʊ wʌt kliːn koʊd mɛnt wɛn aɪ dʒɔɪnd
stress: THANKS | I’VE BEEN PRACTICING EVERY DAY | HONESTLY | I DIDN’T EVEN KNOW what “CLEAN CODE” MEANT when I JOINED
linking:
"didn’t even" → /ˈdɪd.ənt ˈiː.vən/ (glottal stop or full t, even links naturally)
"when I" → /wɛn aɪ/ (link n + aɪ)

speaker: You
text: Totally get it. When I started out, I used to write 500-line functions without thinking twice. I would just try to make it work and ship it.
ipa: ˈtoʊ.tə.li ɡɛt ɪt | wɛn aɪ ˈstɑːr.tɪd aʊt | aɪ ˈjuːst tə raɪt faɪv ˈhʌn.drəd laɪn ˈfʌŋk.ʃənz wɪˈðaʊt ˈθɪŋ.kɪŋ twaɪs | aɪ wʊd dʒəst traɪ tə meɪk ɪt wɜrk ənd ʃɪp ɪt
stress: TOTALLY GET IT | WHEN I STARTED OUT | USED to WRITE 500-LINE FUNCTIONS WITHOUT THINKING TWICE | WOULD JUST TRY to MAKE it WORK and SHIP it
linking:
"started out" → /ˈstɑːr.tɪd aʊt/ (flap or clear T)
"used to" → /ˈjuːst tə/ (to reduced)
"try to" → /traɪ tə/ (to reduced)

speaker: Junior Dev
text: Haha, I’ve done that too. I had written a class last month with almost 800 lines… It was a nightmare to debug.
ipa: hɑː hɑː | aɪv dʌn ðæt tuː | aɪ həd ˈrɪt.n̩ ə klæs læst mʌnθ wɪð ˈɔːl.moʊst ˈeɪt ˈhʌn.drəd laɪnz | ɪt wəz ə ˈnaɪt.mɛr tə diːˈbʌɡ
stress: HAHA | I’VE DONE THAT TOO | HAD WRITTEN a CLASS LAST MONTH with ALMOST 800 LINES | It was a NIGHTMARE to DEBUG
linking:
"had written" → /həd ˈrɪt.n̩/ (had reduced, held t)
"to debug" → /tə diːˈbʌɡ/ (to reduced)

speaker: You
text: Trust me, we’ve all been there. Before we adopted code reviews, people would push straight to main. Things used to break constantly.
ipa: trʌst mi | wiːv ɔːl bɪn ðɛr | bɪˈfɔr wi əˈdɑːp.tɪd koʊd rɪˈvjuːz | ˈpiː.pəl wʊd pʊʃ streɪt tə meɪn | θɪŋz ˈjuːst tə breɪk ˈkɑːn.stənt.li
stress: TRUST ME | WE’VE ALL BEEN THERE | BEFORE WE ADOPTED CODE REVIEWS | PEOPLE WOULD PUSH STRAIGHT to MAIN | THINGS USED to BREAK CONSTANTLY
linking:
"before we" → /bɪˈfɔːr wi/ (before links into pronoun)
"push straight to" → /pʊʃ streɪt tə/ (to reduced)
"used to" → /ˈjuːst tə/ (to reduced)

speaker: Junior Dev
text: Yeah, I’ve heard about those days. So chaotic!
ipa: jæ | aɪv hɜrd əˈbaʊt ðoʊz deɪz | soʊ keɪˈɑː.tɪk
stress: YEAH | I’VE HEARD ABOUT THOSE DAYS | SO CHAOTIC

speaker: You
text: Yeah. But it’s been much better lately. The team has been focusing on writing more testable components. And since we moved to GitHub Actions, our pipelines have been running faster and more reliably.
ipa: jæ | bət ɪts bɪn mʌʧ ˈbɛt.ɚ ˈleɪt.li | ðə tiːm hæz bɪn ˈfoʊ.kə.sɪŋ ɑn ˈraɪ.tɪŋ mɔr ˈtɛs.tə.bəl kəmˈpoʊ.nənts | ənd sɪns wi muːvd tə ˈɡɪt.hʌb ˈæk.ʃənz | aʊr ˈpaɪp.laɪnz hæv bɪn ˈrʌn.ɪŋ ˈfæst.ɚ ənd mɔr rɪˈlaɪ.ə.bli
stress: YEAH | BUT IT’S BEEN MUCH BETTER LATELY | THE TEAM HAS BEEN FOCUSING on WRITING MORE TESTABLE COMPONENTS | SINCE WE MOVED to GITHUB ACTIONS | OUR PIPELINES HAVE BEEN RUNNING FASTER and MORE RELIABLY
linking:
"but it’s" → /bət ɪts/ (but reduced)
"moved to" → /muːvd tə/ (to reduced)
"running faster" → /ˈrʌnɪŋ ˈfæstɚ/ (smooth transition)

speaker: Junior Dev
text: That explains why my builds have been so smooth. I had been struggling with the old CI configs before that switch.
ipa: ðæt ɪkˈspleɪnz waɪ maɪ bɪldz hæv bɪn soʊ smuːð | aɪ həd bɪn ˈstrʌɡ.lɪŋ wɪð ði oʊld siː aɪ ˈkɑːn.fɪɡz bɪˈfɔr ðæt swɪʧ
stress: THAT EXPLAINS WHY MY BUILDS HAVE BEEN SO SMOOTH | HAD BEEN STRUGGLING with the OLD CI CONFIGS BEFORE THAT SWITCH
linking:
"had been" → /həd bɪn/ (had reduced)
"before that" → /bɪˈfɔːr ðæt/ (smooth connection)

speaker: You
text: Same here. I had spent hours debugging build failures last year. Now I barely think about it.
ipa: seɪm hɪr | aɪ həd spɛnt ˈaʊərz diːˈbʌɡ.ɪŋ bɪld ˈfeɪ.ljɚz læst jɪr | naʊ aɪ ˈbɛr.li θɪŋk əˈbaʊt ɪt
stress: SAME HERE | HAD SPENT HOURS DEBUGGING BUILD FAILURES LAST YEAR | NOW I BARELY THINK ABOUT IT
linking:
"had spent" → /həd spɛnt/ (had reduced)
"think about" → /θɪŋk əˈbaʊt/ (k links into about)

speaker: Junior Dev
text: I feel like my understanding of Git has improved too. I’ve finally understood how rebase works — kind of.
ipa: aɪ fiːl laɪk maɪ ˌʌn.dɚˈstæn.dɪŋ əv ɡɪt hæz ɪmˈpruːvd tuː | aɪv ˈfaɪ.nəl.i ˌʌn.dɚˈstʊd haʊ ˈriː.beɪs wɝːks — kaɪnd əv
stress: I FEEL LIKE my UNDERSTANDING of GIT has IMPROVED TOO | FINALLY UNDERSTOOD how REBASE WORKS — KIND of

"understood how" → /ˌʌn.dɚˈstʊd haʊ/ (d links into how)

speaker: You
text: Oh man, rebasing. It used to terrify me. I would always prefer merging to avoid conflicts, even if it made the history messy.
ipa: oʊ mæn | ˈriː.beɪ.sɪŋ | ɪt ˈjuːst tə ˈtɛ.rəˌfaɪ miː | aɪ wʊd ˈɔːl.weɪz prɪˈfɝː ˈmɝː.dʒɪŋ tə əˈvɔɪd ˈkɑːn.flɪkts | ˈiː.vən ɪf ɪt meɪd ðə ˈhɪs.tɚ.i ˈmɛ.si
stress: OH MAN | REBASING | USED to TERRIFY ME | WOULD ALWAYS PREFER MERGING to AVOID CONFLICTS | EVEN IF IT MADE the HISTORY MESSY
linking:
"used to" → /ˈjuːst tə/ (to reduced)
"prefer merging" → /prɪˈfɝː ˈmɝːʤɪŋ/ (smooth connection)
"to avoid" → /tə əˈvɔɪd/ (to reduced)

speaker: Junior Dev
text: Exactly! That’s still me sometimes. But I’ve been practicing with dummy branches just to get comfortable.

stress: EXACTLY | THAT’S STILL ME SOMETIMES | BUT I’VE BEEN PRACTICING with DUMMY BRANCHES just to GET COMFORTABLE
linking:
"but I’ve" → /bət aɪv/ (but reduced)
"just to" → /dʒəst tə/ (to reduced)
"get comfortable" → /ɡɛt ˈkʌmfɚtəbəl/ (t links into adjective)

speaker: You
text: That’s the way. And it shows — your last rebase was super clean. Keep doing what you’ve been doing.
ipa: ðæts ðə weɪ | ənd ɪt ʃoʊz | jɚ læst ˈriː.beɪs wəz ˈsuː.pɚ kliːn | kip ˈduː.ɪŋ wʌt juv bɪn ˈduː.ɪŋ
